text: Suppose a company called Custom Steel Products (CSP for short) supplies materials to builders. One common structure that CSP makes is called a truss. You might see a truss holding up a bridge or the roof of a building. The following is a picture of a truss. It is made by fastening together steel rods 1 foot long.
This truss has an overall length of 7 feet. The manager at CSP needs to know the number of rods in _any length_ of truss a customer might order.
- Describe a pattern that the manager can use to predict the number of rods for any length of truss. Does the pattern represent a linear relationship? Explain.
- How does this pattern compare to the patterns found in Problems 1.1 and 1.2?
- Are you equally confident about the predictions you made for Problems 1.1 and 1.2 and this problem?
